column5: Hey there, I haven't posted much but I read the posts on a weekly basis and I know there is a lot of knowledge on this site.  I'm looking to go fishing tomorrow and was wondering if anyone has any good lakes that are good for Pike right now?  I'm not looking for specific spots, just the lakes in general.  I've got a 14ft boat and looking around 2 hrs from Toronto.  If anyone has any ideas of some good lakes to try tomorrow I would be thankful for your input.  Cheers!!!
Newboro, Indian, Clear Lakes---Lotsa pike --none huge.   Friend from there ( Newboro) emailed me last we that the bite was on.    JK
Never been to any of those lakes so I'll look into them.  Thank you!!  I was thinking of Lake St. John or Gloucester Pool.  Has anyone been there lately?
You could try out Little Lk in Barrie, Duckworth St exit, there's a lot of smaller pike there.
I've been to that one last year and it was pretty good.  Lot's of small fish I found.  Very shallow as well.  Thank you though!!
Lake Dalrymple...infested with pike.  Canal lake...ditto
What about Cook's Bay on Lake Simcoe?
